headline: Will Capital Discipline and Rate Environment Fuel Occidental's Growth?

headline: Oil Prices Are Jumping. What History Says Happens When Conflicts Threaten Supply.
summary: For the past 40 years, the biggest increases in oil prices have all been driven by demand, not supply.

headline: Metalworking Fluids Market worth $14.7 billion by 2029, at a CAGR of 3.7%, says MarketsandMarkets™
summary: Delray Beach, FL, June 19, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- In terms of value, the Metalworking Fluids Market is estimated to grow from USD 12.2 billion in 2024 to USD 14.7 billion by 2029, at a CAGR of 3.7%, as per the recent study by MarketsandMarkets™. Metalworking fluids market have grown as the demand from automotive industry, and high-performance machinery is mounted immensely worldwide in the last two decades. These factors drive the metalworking fluids market. The market for metalworking fluids

headline: Brazil’s Foz do Amazonas oil exploration draws major bids
summary: Two consortia involving Petrobras and ExxonMobil secured ten blocks in total.

headline: ExxonMobil Recommends Shareholders Reject Below-Market Mini-Tender Offer by TRC Capital Investment Corporation
summary: SPRING, Texas, June 19, 2025--Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) has received notice of an unsolicited mini-tender offer by TRC Capital Investment Corporation to purchase up to 1 million shares of ExxonMobil common stock, which represents approximately 0.023 percent of the shares outstanding as of the June 9, 2025 offer date.
